intro: Hieracium aequiparabile, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium aequiparabile is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread through rhizomes.
